Eczema.recommendation: Maintain skin moisture using hypoallergenic creams. Avoid harsh soaps. Consult a dermatologist if itching persists or skin becomes infected.
Eczema.warning: Avoid scratching as it can cause skin thickening and potential infections.

symptoms: A large brownish spot with darker speckles
A mole that changes in color, size or feel
A small lesion with an irregular border
Dark lesions on palms or soles
Melanoma.recommendation: IMMEDIATE CONSULTATION REQUIRED. Melanoma is a serious form of skin cancer. Early detection is crucial for successful treatment.
Melanoma.warning: Do not delay medical evaluation. This condition requires professional diagnosis and potentially a biopsy.

Normal.recommendation: Continue regular skin care and sun protection (SPF 30+). Monitor for any new or changing spots as part of routine health checks.
Normal.warning: Always protect your skin from excessive UV exposure.

symptoms: Red patches of skin covered with thick, silvery scales
Dry, cracked skin that may bleed
Psoriasis.recommendation: Topical treatments, light therapy, and stress management are often helpful. Consult a doctor for a personalized treatment plan.
Psoriasis.warning: Psoriasis can be associated with other health conditions like psoriatic arthritis.

symptoms: A flat, flesh-colored or brown scar-like lesion
A bleeding or scabbing sore that heals and returns
Basal Cell Carcinoma.recommendation: Schedule a dermatological exam. While rarely spreading to other parts of the body, it can be locally invasive.
Basal Cell Carcinoma.warning: Treating early prevents significant tissue damage.
